Christopher Xie

I am a PhD student in the Paul G. Allen School of Computer Science and Engineering at the University of Washington. I am currently working with Dieter Fox. In the past, I have been fortunate to have worked with Emily Fox and Zaid Harchaoui. I am interested in the intersection of machine learning, computer vision, and robotics. I completed my undergraduate studies at University of California, Berkeley, in the EECS department.

I was graciously supported by a National Defense Science and Engineering Graduate (NDSEG) Fellowship from 2016-2019.

Contact me at chrisxie [at] cs [dot] washington [dot] edu



News and Announcements

  • 7/2020: Started internship at Google Research Seattle.
  • 7/2020: Our extended version of UOIS-Net has been posted to arXiv.
  • 6/2020: Our workshop paper has been accepted and selected for a spotlight presentation at the ICML Object-Oriented Learning Workshop.
  • 9/2019: Our paper on unseen object instance segmentation has been accepted to CoRL 2019. We have released code as well.
  • 7/2019: A new preprint on unseen object instance segmentation has been posted to arXiv.
  • 3/2019: Our paper on object discovery has been accepted to CVPR 2019.
  • 1/2019: Our paper on object tracking has been accepted to ICRA 2019.
  • 12/2018: A new preprint on object discovery has been posted to arXiv.
  • 6/2018: Our paper on online nonstationary time series prediction was accepted to IEEE SPL.
  • 3/2018: Started internship at NVIDIA Robotics Research Lab.
  • 10/2017: A new preprint on time series prediction has been posted to arXiv.
  • 12/2016: I received the award of Best Oral Presentation at the NIPS Time Series Workshop.
  • 11/2016: Our workshop paper has been accepted and selected for an oral presentation at the NIPS Time Series Workshop.
  • 11/2016: A new preprint on online nonstationary time series prediction has been posted to arXiv.
  • 6/2016: Started summer internship at Microsoft.
  • 4/2016: I have received a National Defense Science and Engineering Graduate (NDSEG) Fellowship.
  • 1/2016: Our paper on model-based RL for physical systems has been accepted to ICRA 2016.
  • 9/2015: Started graduate school at University of Washington.
  • 5/2015: Started summer internship at Google (Project Aura, previously known as Google Glass).
  • 5/2015: Graduated from UC Berkeley.
  • 1/2015: Our paper on motion planning has been accepted to ICRA 2015.
